title: AlvisArray
content:
#

Description: Provides js-like array operations. Use new AlVisArray([]) to create
an array.


1. push#

Add new data.

Required parameters 1

value：value eg: arr.push(1)

Required parameters 2

category：category label, such as x-axis labels or category labels.

value: Values label, such as y-axis labels or value labels.

eg: arr.push({ month: 'Monday1', sales: 55 }), where month is category and sales
is value.


2.pop#

Delete the last data in the array without providing parameters.


3. set#

Modify the elements in an array.

Required parameters

category：category label, such as x-axis labels or category labels.

value: Values label, such as y-axis labels or value labels.

eg: arr.set({ month: 'Tuesday', sales: 20 }), where month is category and sales
is value.


4. insert#

Insert an element at any position.

Required parameters

category：category label, such as x-axis labels or category labels.

value: Values label, such as y-axis labels or value labels.

place: Element insertion position

eg: arr.insert({ month: 'Tuesday2', sales: 200 }, 3), where month is category
and sales is value, insert element at position 3.


5. delete#

Delete any element in the array.

Optional parameters

category：category label, such as x-axis labels or category labels.

value: Values label, such as y-axis labels or value labels.

eg: arr.delete({ month: 'Tuesday' }) or arr.delete({ sales: 200 }), where month
is category and sales is value.


6. length#

Return the length of array.

title: AlvisStack
content:
#

Description: Provides stack-related operations. Use new AlVisStack([]) to create
an array.


1. push(params)#

Push to stack.

Required parameters 1

value：value

eg: stack.push(1)

Required parameters 2

category：category label, such as x-axis labels or category labels.

value: Values label, such as y-axis labels or value labels.

eg: stack.push({ month: 'Monday1', sales: 55 }), where month is category and
sales is value.


2.pop()#

Pop the stack without providing any parameters.


3. clear()#

Clear the stack.


4. size()#

Returns the size of the stack.


5. isEmpty#

Returns whether the stack is empty.

title: Algorithm-Visualization
content:
#


DataStructure#

 1. AlvisArray
 2. AlvisStack


Gallery#

 * Bubble Sort

Divide&conquer and Reduce&conquer#

 * Quick Sort
